intro: Erechtites ignobilis, commonly known as the roughleaf coneflower, is a flowering plant native to the central and eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant features rough, hairy stems and leaves that are typically lance-shaped with serrated edges. Its flowers are yellow in color, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets, and it blooms from late summer to early fall. Erechtites ignobilis is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands.
